description: Sven Halek, after weighing the city's unrest and Council paralysis, triggers Halden's 'resilience test' protocol from Bar 101, cutting citywide access to BCI scores. He leaves an unsigned notecard behind: 'Let them speak to one another.'
Stenograd residents wake to find BCI scores inaccessible. Public services, work access, and housing entry are thrown into confusion. Council issues a temporary statement citing 'systems review.'

Halden's decrypted 'resilience test' logs surface among Council members, confirming the blackout is deliberate. Factional debate erupts over whether to restore central order or engage citizens directly.
Civic assemblies and crowd meetings spontaneously form in squares and transit hubs. Council members are confronted by angry citizens demanding explanations and alternatives to BCI control.

Conflicting experiments arise: some neighborhoods set up their own trust-based access protocols, others advocate for full abolition of rankings. The city debates the future of compliance amid Council disarray.
